tmrm_tuple
[libtmrm public routines]

tmrm_tuple represents a tuple in the path language. More...

Detailed Description

tmrm_tuple represents a tuple in the path language.

Function Documentation

tmrm_tuple* tmrm_tuple_clone ( tmrm_tuple *  t_src  ) 

int tmrm_tuple_compare ( tmrm_tuple *  t,
tmrm_tuple *  other,
tmrm_tuple *  order,
int(*)(const tmrm_object *, const tmrm_object *)  compare 
)

Compares two tuples with the use of an ordering tuple.

The ordering tuple is a magic tuple that only contains ordering values. => enum? * TMRM_ORDER_DESC, TMRM_ORDER_ASC, TMRM_ORDER_IGNORE

int tmrm_tuple_concat ( tmrm_tuple *  t,
tmrm_tuple *  t2 
)

Appends all elements of t2 to t1.

Returns 0 on success. t and t2 may be the same tuple.

Returns:
0 on success

int tmrm_tuple_equals ( tmrm_tuple *  t,
tmrm_tuple *  other,
int(*)(const tmrm_object *, const tmrm_object *)  compare 
)

Returns 1 if the tuples t and other are equal, 0 otherwise.

Two tuples are compared by comparing all their values (using the compare function).

void tmrm_tuple_free ( tmrm_tuple *  t  ) 

Free's a tuple and its values.

tmrm_object* tmrm_tuple_get_at ( tmrm_tuple *  t,
size_t  idx

Returns the value at position 'idx' or NULL if an error occurs.

tmrm_tuple* tmrm_tuple_new ( size_t  size,
tmrm_object *  values[],
tmrm_tuple_free_method *  free_method 
)

Creates a new tuple object with a given size.

The caller is responsible for freeing the object with tmrm_tuple_free(). The tuple may be initialized with values which is an array of tmrm_object pointers. The function copies the _pointers_ but not the underlying objects.

Parameters:
size The size of the tuple.
values array of tmrm_object pointers
free_method Pointer to a function that free's _one_ value
See also:
tmrm_tuple_free
Returns:
NULL on failure (out of memory).

int tmrm_tuple_size ( tmrm_tuple *  t  ) 

Returns the count of elements in the tuple, or a value below zero if an error occurs.

int tmrm_tuple_slice ( tmrm_tuple *  t,
size_t  j,
size_t  k 
)

Slices a tuple t t(j.

.k) = PROD [from i=j to k] <vi> and t(i) = t(i..i)

Returns:
0 on success

int tmrm_tuple_zip ( tmrm_tuple *  values,
tmrm_tuple *  keys,
tmrm_proxy **  p 
)

Zips the value and keys tuple into a new proxy.

'values' and 'keys' must have equal size. The type of all values in keys must be tmrm_proxy. 'values' can contain both tmrm_proxy and tmrm_literal objects. The proxy must be free'd with tmrm_proxy_free(). Returns 0 on success.
